Key Match Events: The Oakland Athletics laid down three consecutive bunts to start the top of the 12th inning, scoring two runs to break a 2-2 tie in an eventual 4-3 win over the Houston Astros.
Post-Match Reflections: Houston manager Joe Espada was disappointed in his team’s defense in the 12th. 'We just didn’t do a good job of handling the ball there in that inning,' Espada said.
Astros manager Joe Espada said 'We battled to the end. We had the right guys at the plate when we wanted to and we just couldn’t — it was just one of those games.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mariners also lost to the Padres at home Tuesday, keeping Houston’s division lead at 4 1/2 games.
Houston had a runner on third with two outs in the 10th when Jeremy Peña hit a fly ball to right field, but Cameron made a diving catch to rob him of a hit and end the inning.
Others: Oakland Athletics manager Mark Kotsay said 'That was well-executed. Obviously, Daz was bunting for a hit … We had a couple of guys up there that can bunt and they do a good job with it with Schuman and Allen. We took our chances there getting a run.'
